item.description:
Saturday Nov. 6 – Worchester Art Museum – meet in the main lobby at 11:30am.
·FREE FIRST Saturday Mornings (the first Saturday of each month) 10am-noon


The Worcester Art Museum is world-renowned for its 35,000-piece collection of paintings, sculpture, decorative arts, photography, prints, drawings and new media. The works span 5,000 years of art and culture. View paintings by Cassatt, Gauguin, Goya, Monet, Sargent and Whistler; admire floor mosaics from the ancient city of Antioch; see cutting-edge contemporary art; and discover the Museum's many other treasures. Special exhibitions showcase the masterworks, seldom-seen gems, and important works on loan.

Enjoy a delectable lunch in The Museum Café, browse The Museum Shop for unique gifts and check out our latest Classes Brochure for a current list of youth, teen and adult class and workshop offerings plus our Travel Learning program.

General Information
Worcester Art Museum
55 Salisbury Street, Worcester, Massachusetts 01609
Phone: 508.799.4406
information@worcesterart.org

Hours & Admission

Gallery Hours
Saturday: 10am-5pm
The Museum Café Hours-Saturday: 11:30am-2pm
Admission
· MembersFree
· Non-members$14 Adults$12 Seniors and College Students with ID
FREE for kids 17 and under
FREE FIRST Saturday Mornings (the first Saturday of each month) 10am-noon
item.name: Come in out of the cold and enjoy some culture!
